tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE dietary_preferences (
  customer_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_name VARCHAR(50),
  dietary_restriction VARCHAR(50),
  preference_1 VARCHAR(50),
  preference_2 VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Customers (
  customer_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  email VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  dietary_restrictions VARCHAR(255),
  preferences VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE MenuOptions (
  option_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  cuisine_type VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  dish_name VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  ingredients TEXT,
  dietary_info VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
  price DECIMAL(10, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE Orders (
    order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    customer_id INT,
    option_id INT,
    order_date DATE,
    FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES Customers(customer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (option_id) REFERENCES MenuOptions(option_id)
);

CREATE TABLE MenuOptions (
  option_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  cuisine_type VARCHAR(50),
  dish_name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  ingredients VARCHAR(200),
  price DECIMAL(8, 2)
);

CREATE TABLE Orders (
  order_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  option_id INT,
  order_date DATE,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES Customers(customer_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (option_id) REFERENCES MenuOptions(option_id)
);

CREATE TABLE Ratings (
  rating_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  customer_id INT,
  option_id INT,
  rating INT,
  FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES Customers(customer_id),
  FOREIGN KEY (option_id) REFERENCES MenuOptions(option_id)
);

CREATE TABLE customers (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
email VARCHAR(100) UNIQUE,
dietary_restrictions VARCHAR(100));

CREATE TABLE countries (code VARCHAR(3) PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL);

CREATE TABLE recipes (id INT PRIMARY KEY,
name VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
country_code VARCHAR(3),
difficulty_level VARCHAR(20));

CREATE TABLE customer_preferences (customer_id INT,
recipe_id INT,
PRIMARY KEY (customer_id, recipe_id),
FOREIGN KEY (customer_id) REFERENCES customers(id),
FOREIGN KEY (recipe_id) REFERENCES recipes(id));
